intro: Ixocactus inornus, commonly known as the Mexican apple cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that are ribbed and covered in small, spiny areoles. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding ornamental value to its appearance. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Ixocactus inornus is a popular choice for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and drought tolerance.
